alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Pearl River; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 9:24PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN HARRISON, HANCOCK AND SOUTHEASTERN PEARL RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM CST... At 924 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stennis Space Center, or 9 miles southeast of Picayune, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stennis Space Center and Kiln. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 7 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 10 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Pearl River; Southern Hancock
